abstracts.cdata!:
This Environmental Assessment addresses
            current concerns regarding potential negative impacts on the
            environment, as a result of the Long Term Water Supply
            Project in Senegal, namely, the fragility of underground
            water resources; the water supply deficit in the Greater
            Dakar area - surface water resources with multiple uses;
            and, the negligent waste water collection, and treatment
            systems - a social situation aggravated by sanitary risks,
            due to the limited access to infrastructure sanitation by
            the population. Mitigating measures include: 1) Although
            underground effluents will progressively diminish,
            benefiting the Lake Guiers surface waters, measures suggest
            monitoring and evaluation of the underground effluents in
            Dakar and the Northern region, following the temporary
            exploitation phase, and, establish formal control
            procedures, building management capacity to better service
            water resources. 2) Concerning surface waters, the creation
            of a local authority is recommended, to manage the lake
            water resources, and, establish legal, and regulatory
            frameworks to control water pollution, through an
            operational management plan, which should include costs,
            financial management, and taxation systems. 3) Waste
            disposal should be addressed in the technical specifications
            of procurement documents, emphasizing environmental
            management as it concerns, industrial pollution,
            agricultural land, and, noise, and air pollution control. 4)
            To avoid potential controversies, community consultations
            should be established, to include financial compensation for
            land losses, and, public health issues should also be
            integrated in the procurement documents.
